description: {"blocks":[{"key":"2v2m6","text":"This protocol is meant to provide researchers with a step by step procedure on how to prepare glycerol stocks in order to preserve and store bacteria for long term. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1da8t","text":"Bacterial glycerol stocks are important for long-term storage of plasmids. The addition of glycerol stabilizes the frozen bacteria, preventing damage to the cell membranes and keeping the cells alive. A glycerol stock of bacteria can be stored stably at -80°C for many years and -20°C for several months.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1b2h0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"322k8","text":"Freezing is an efficient way of storing bacteria. Glycerol allows to reduce the harmful effect of ice crystals on bacteria which can damage cells by dehydration through the a localized increase in salt concentration leading to denaturation of proteins. Additionally, ice crystals can also puncture cellular membranes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aa5m7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: Glycerol stocks, Bacteria stocks, Bacteria glycerol stocks, Store bacteria

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.section: Preparing liquid culture of the bacteria to be stored
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9u8mp","text":"Prepare LB following this protocol depending on the desired amount of LB and subsequent number of glycerol stock tubes needed.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":26,"length":8}],"data":{}},{"key":"5qs6u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"21nt2","text":"Using an inoculating wire loop, pick up some bacteria colonies from a culture plate and inoculate in an Erlenmeyer flask containing the LB (with the right antibiotic if applicable).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"80a9t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"oank","text":"Grow the cells by incubating in an incubator at   for  to obtain maximum cell growth.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":48,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":54,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"79rsc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"75EA6560D06611ECB0120F1B58CF07B4","url":"https://www.protocols.io/view/preparing-lb-broth-or-agar-antibiotic-5jyl896prv2w/v1"}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"9179044CEBF411ECB2DC0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}},"2":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":10800,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"91790538EBF411ECB2DC0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":false,"start":null,"temperature":"37","unit":10}}}}

steps.section: Diluting Pure Glycerol to 50% with Distilled water
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"a9tvl","text":"Use a sterile measuring cylinder to measure  of distilled water and equal amount   of   into a 50ml falcon tube.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":44,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":81,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":86,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"72sfb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"338k3","text":"Cork the tube and shake thoroughly until the liquids are evenly mixed","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c3uog","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"5B678450D11211EC94DF2DEF6D3C406B","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"5E10AB50D11211EC94DF2DEF6D3C406B","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"2":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":955805,"mol_weight":0,"name":"Glycerol","linfor":"","url":"","sku":"","cas_number":"56-81-5","rrid":"","public":1,"can_edit":0,"guid":"F50F7020EBF411ECBAC4C1439DDC2525","in_steps":null,"vendor":{"id":298,"name":"Sigma – Aldrich","link":"https://www.sigmaaldrich.com/","image":{"source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png","placeholder":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7dpq9","text":"Use a 20ml sterile syringe to aspirate the 50% glycerol from the falcon tube ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"13hdj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c0qn2","text":"Plug in a 0.2µm micro filter and filter out the glycerol into a sterile falcon tube","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9i6ob","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fadpv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Aliquoting the bacterial culture into 50% glycerol and storing
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8l07u","text":"To make 1ml of Bacteria glycerol stocks, aliquot 500µl of the filtered 50% glycerol into separate 1.5ml Eppendorf tubes (triplicates or more depending on the quantity of glycerol stocks needed.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7oiaq","text":"Use sterile micropipette and tips to measure out equal volumes ( ) of the bacterial culture from the Erlenmeyer flask into the tubes containing the 50% glycerol (The final proportions of your glycerol stock should be 50% bacteria and 50% diluted glycerol).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":64,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"36gu8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2t0lo","text":"Keep your thumb pressed firmly against the lid of the Eppendorf tube and  shake vigorously to make sure the 2 liquids mix completely.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1j46b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bqlgu","text":"Use a marker pen to label the tubes with the name of the bacterial strain and date of preparation of the glycerol stock","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"99k81","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d24pv","text":"Store the vials in the freezer at -20°C until they are used.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"500","error":false,"guid":"4EA3A550D06311ECB0120F1B58CF07B4","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

steps.section: Aliquoting the bacterial culture into 50% glycerol and storing
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8frh1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9c7qr","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"95bn0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"en2u1","text":"After pipetting the bacteria culture and 50% Glycerol, shake several times to ensure it mixes completely and uniformly.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"67uqb","text":"Bacteria glycerol stocks prepared and stored in this manner are stable for up to year.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"avm70","text":"Avoid frequent freeze-thaw of the glycerol stocks.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"b0c84","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

title: Preparation of Bacteria Glycerol Stocks
warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"61jph","text":"Endeavor to segregate the waste generated and discard appropriately.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
